meanings.sent1: After their argument, they decided to conciliate and make up.
meanings.sent2: The mediator helped conciliate the two conflicting parties.
meanings.sent3: The siblings always conciliate after a disagreement with a hug.
meanings.sent4: Her soothing words were able to conciliate the tense atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The image of a dove carrying an olive branch symbolizes conciliation.

meanings.sent1: He tried to conciliate his angry boss by offering to work overtime.
meanings.sent2: The politician attempted to conciliate the voters by promising lower taxes.
meanings.sent3: The cat conciliated its owner by purring and rubbing against their leg.
meanings.sent4: Her sincere apology was enough to conciliate his hurt feelings.
meanings.sent5: The delicious cake was meant to conciliate any upset guests at the party.

meanings.definition: To bring into agreement or harmony
meanings.sent1: The music conciliated the diverse tastes of the audience.
meanings.sent2: The teacher tried to conciliate the different opinions of the students.
meanings.sent3: The colorful painting conciliated the room's mismatched furniture.
meanings.sent4: Her leadership skills were able to conciliate the team's conflicting ideas.
meanings.sent5: The beautiful sunset conciliated the couple's differing moods.
